reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: This boutique apt hotel is very conveniently located to everything downtown and to many buses. The rooms are bright, large by Euro stds and very well equipped with IKEA accessories and Icelandic woolens. Robes are included. Kitchen is especially well equipped down to scizzors and cutting boards and a desk that folds out to dining table. Breakfast makings are supplied daily, as is fresh fruit, whole cartons milk and juice and plenty of tea and excellent coffee. Rooms are cozy due to geothermal heat and large soaking tub with pillow. Only complaints are 1) not enough hooks for towels, robes, toiletries; 2) no facecloths (though all the good restaurants provided them for hand drying) and 3) because of bus lines and skylight on the main drag, traffic noise is bad in the morning (despite reports here) and 4) handheld shower and no screen, so floor got soaked regularly. Breakfast includes meat and cheese and vegs, a wonder considering the cost of fresh stuff in IS, but was not large enough for my spouse. Grocers nearby make supplementing this easy. Restaurants in IS are VERY expensive for our taste ($50 lunches???). The female staff on duty on our arrival and departure was surly but the rest of the week friendly. Free Internet good except one day.
reviews.title: Excellent location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Reykjavik Residence for 2 nights in mid-September 2011.
reviews.title: A cosy home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: The building itself is bright and cheerful and very well located, just steps away from the downtown shopping area and 5 minutes from a 24 hour grocery store.
reviews.title: Elegant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception area is cosy and very welcoming. Our room with kitchenette on the second floor (just up one flight of stairs) was bright, very comfortable and tastefully decorated with a gorgeous and relaxing colour palette. The small kitchen was equipped with pretty much everything you need for a basic meal (plates, cutlery, bowls, cups, mugs, sharp knives, pots and pans, etc.). Every day, you get a breakfast plate with bread slices, butter, jams, cheese, ham and crudites to start off the day (very basic but much better, imo, than the typical continental breakfast of croissants and sweet danishes). There is a kettle and coffee pot with ground coffee and tea bags for that first caffeine jolt of the day. Our bathroom was large, clean, bright and stylish with a heated towel rack (always a nice touch). The internet reception was very strong and easy to connect to (no sign in pages). Overall, I just loved our room and would not consider going anywhere else if we returned to Reykjavik.
reviews.title: Only OK...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, a special mention to Guđbjartur and all the hotel staff who were all extremely friendly, polite, helpful (they made restaurant and other reservations for us) and patient. They all made us feel welcome and made our stay in Reykjavik a wonderful and memorable one!
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Staying at 'Reykjavik Residence' for this year's "Airwaves" music festival.
reviews.title: Excellent accomodation in Reykjavik !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location just in the centre of everything (only one block away from the main shopping street 'Laugavegur'). Even the small apartment is spacious and nicely decorated- not (only) with the usual IKEA stuff. Very well equipped with helpful tools in the pantrykitchen and free WiFi. Only the ordinary breakfast ingredients don't reach the high standard (but especially cheese and greens are often quite tasteless on the island, sorry).
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Not at least very friendly and helpful staff and manager.
reviews.title: Tons of Good Things About this Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Thank you very much. I definitely will come back again.
reviews.title: Can't Stop Thinking About Iceland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. This is not really a hotel, there is no room service and no restaurant. It looks newly refurbished. Staff is friendly and helpful and most speak English. We had a large room with IKEA furniture and the bathroom was nice but the hot water smelled bad. Too much traffic noise from the street though for a good night. Hard to find parking. Close to the bars, restaurants and shopping in the centre.
reviews.title: Great location, spacious accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a superior studio for 3 nights. The room was big (including a small kitchen), clean and confortable with lovely furnishures. The staff are very friendly and helpfull. The location is perfect, one block from the main street while quiet! I would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: A place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Reykjavik Residence Hotel was fantastic, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it as a top place to stay in Reykjavik in this price category. We thought the location was perfect, it was really clean and comfortable and it was great value for money! Ilhan and Guðbjartur who run the hotel are amazing, they were so friendly and helpful and really made the experience wonderful. When I return to Reykjavik, there is no question that I will be staying here again due to the wonderful experience we had. Thanks again for making our trip so special!!
reviews.title: This is a GREAT place to stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Perfect choice for our 3 nights in Reykjavik! We stayed in the 2 bedroom apt which was very spacious and well organized, with a large bathroom and full 4 person kitchen table. Breakfast and coffee in the room was a great way to start our day before heading out on our tours. The front desk was very helpful with recommendations and were flexible with our check-in/out. Location is ideal, just one block from the major shopping and restaurants, and free wi-fi was very helpful for booking our excursions and keeping in touch with home. We would select this hotel again hands down for our next trip!
reviews.title: Comfort, location, and friendly & helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from a trip to Iceland, spending five nights at the Reykjavik Residence Hotel in a studio apartment and we can honestly say it is a fantastic place to stay.
reviews.title: Really Lovely! Home from Home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms are decorated beautifully and all of the furnishings make the rooms very comfortable - so much so it was hard to get out of the lovely beds in the morning! We also got lots of British TV channels, so sometimes we did forget we were in a hotel and not in our home!
reviews.title: Warm welcome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed here for three nights with my husband and we were both really pleased with the hotel and the service from the staff. I couldn't fault the room, it was well decorated, clean and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel offers free wifi, which we found useful for booking trips and if you need to print anything out there is a computer and printer in the reception area. The staff were polite, friendly and happy to help with advice on things to do and booking return flybus transfers. The hotel is situated one street below laugavegur, which is where you will find most of the shops, bars and restaurants. We stayed mid-week and it was very quiet at night; I imagine you would hear noise from the street at weekends but this is true of any of the central hotels. I also thought it was great value, especially considering that Iceland is a relatively expensive destination.
reviews.title: Great apartment hotel in a fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Residence because of its central location and because we needed parking for our hire car. We only stayed one night (our first night) but wish we had spent more time here (and less at Hotel Ranga!). We drove from the airport in the dark (using our SatNav) and found the place easily enough - parking is available in the road to the rear of the hotel and you can access the hotel from the rear, so it's easy to carry your cases in.
reviews.title: Would definitely say here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a large double room in the basement fronting the street. The room was very nicely furnished and very clean. Free WiFi worked well in the room. The kitchenette was well equipped (fridge, toaster, kettle, coffee machine) and the breakfast, which is left in the fridge for you, was good - milk, bread, jam, butter, 2 large cartons of juice, cheese and ham with cereal, tea & coffee in the cupboard.
reviews.title: Great luxury apartment!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The main shopping area is the next road up from the Residence and there are loads of places to eat - there is an excellent Vegetarian cafe one block away which is open in the evening. It's also easy to walk to the harbour and the Cathedral (Hallgrímskirkja) from the Hotel. If you visit the cathedral take the lift to the top of the tower for super views over Reykjavik (the bells will make you jump!)
reviews.title: Just the place we needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The manager was very helpful - carried our bags, helped me park the car and changed the breakfast ham for cheese when we mentioned we were vegetarian!
reviews.title: Stay here you will love it!
